New York University Archives
Records of the College of Engineering, Research Division
New York University. College of Engineering
RG.24.1
1.5 linear feet in 3 manuscript boxes
1936-1964 The New York University School of Engineering was founded in 1854 as the School of Civil Engineering and Architecture. In 1973, the School merged with the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn. The Records of the College of Engineering, Research Division (dated 1936-1964) documents the College's research output, and includes project reports, as well as policy and procedure documents. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The Records of the College of Engineering, Research Division (dated 1936-1964) documents the College's research output, and includes project reports, as well as policy and procedure documents.
Historical Note
The New York University School of Engineering was founded in 1854 as the School of Civil Engineering and Architecture. In 1973, the School merged with the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Original order is unknown.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact New York University Archives, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
These materials were removed from the New York University Archives Collection of Publications and Ephemera during processing; their original provenance is unknown.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Records of the College of Engineering, Research Division; RG 24.1; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and described on the collection-level with a folder-level inventory.
